title: After a Heated Argument
situation: You and someone you care about had a heated argument last week. Things are polite now but still tense.
question: How do you reopen the conversation to repair?

choices.label: Pretend nothing happened and hope time will fix it.
choices.outcome: The tension fades on the surface, but some part of the relationship stays guarded.
choices.insight: Time can lower the volume of conflict, but repair usually needs some explicit acknowledgement.

choices.label: Say, “I’ve been thinking about our argument and I don’t want that to be the last big thing between us. Could we talk about what happened when you’re ready?”
choices.outcome: You show care and openness without forcing them to engage immediately.
choices.insight: Inviting conversation instead of demanding it respects both your need for repair and their need for readiness.

choices.label: Send a long message listing everything they did wrong and how they should fix it.
choices.outcome: They may feel attacked and focus on defending themselves instead of reconnecting.
choices.insight: Repair is easiest when both people can own something, not just one.
